goal.core.mentalstate

Class MentalState

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.mentalstate.MentalState

  • public class MentalState
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a mental state of an agent and provides query and update functionality. A mental state consists of one or more MentalModels: A model to represent the percepts, mail messages, knowledge, beliefs, and goals of the agent owner of this state and models for representing other agent's beliefs and goals.

    Assumes that a mental state is represented using a single knowledge representation language, i.e. KRlanguage.

    To get notified about changes you can subscribe as Observer to the individual BeliefBases. You can also subscribe to a top-level GoalBase and receive all sub-module change info too.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Constructor Detail

      • MentalState

        public MentalState(AgentId id,
           GOALProgram program,
           Debugger debugger)
            throws KRInitFailedException
        Creates a mental state of an agent, including the initial belief and goal bases, a mailbox and a percept base. Knowledge is added to both the belief base of the agent and each of the individual goals included in the goal base.
        Parameters:
        id - The agent that owns this MentalState.
        program - The parsed GOALProgram of the agent
        debugger - The current debugger
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - when initialization of the belief base, goal base, mailbox or percept base failed.

      • getOwnBase

        public BeliefBase getOwnBase(BASETYPE type)
        Returns a BeliefBase that is of a particular BASETYPE.

        Can ask for BASETYPE.KNOWLEDGEBASE, BASETYPE.BELIEFBASE, BASETYPE.PERCEPTBASE, BASETYPE.MAILBOX. Other types are not supported by this method.

        Parameters:
        type - The type of belief base.
        Returns:
        A belief base of a particular type.

      • getAttentionSet

        public GoalBase getAttentionSet()
        Returns the current attention set of the agent. Always returns the attention set at the deepest focus level.
        Returns:
        The current attention set (set of goals) of the agent.

      • getAttentionStack

        public java.util.Stack<GoalBase> getAttentionStack()

        Returns:
        The stack of goal bases (attention sets) of the agent.

      • addAgentModel

        public void addAgentModel(AgentId id,
                 Debugger debugger,
                 GOALProgram... goalProgram)
                   throws KRInitFailedException
        Adds a MentalModel for a (new) agent. Also used to create a mental model for the owner of this MentalState. CHECK that this method is thread safe. The agent may be running when this is called!
        Parameters:
        id - The agent for which a mental model should be created.
        debugger - debugger to report on associated belief update. Note: As during initialization the debugger needs to be different (in order to avoid halting on this action) than during agent execution (when the agent's debugger should be used), debugger is a parameter of the method.
        goalProgram - The GOALProgram associated with the agent (if its me)
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - If the KR technology failed to create the requested databases.

      • removeAgentModel

        public void removeAgentModel(AgentId id)
        Removes a MentalModel of another agent from this MentalState. Also deletes any references to this agent in the belief base of the owner of this mental state (i.e. also removes the related 'agent(name)' fact). SHOULD ONLY BE USED TO REMOVE OTHER AGENTS' MODELS.
        Parameters:
        id - The name of the agent whose model needs to be removed.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Cleans up all databases maintained in this agent's MentalModel and removes the agent's mental model.

      • adopt

        public boolean adopt(Update update,
            boolean focus,
            Debugger debugger,
            AgentId... agent)
        Goal is inserted in goal base associated with the agent, but only if goal is not already present.
        Parameters:
        update - The goal to be adopted.
        focus - Indicates whether focus attention set should be used or not.
        debugger - Debugger monitoring adoption.
        agent - An optional agent to do the adoption for; the current agent is used otherwise
        Returns:
        success or failure.

      • updateGoalState

        public void updateGoalState(Debugger debugger,
                   AgentId... agent)
        Checks whether any goals have been achieved in the mean time, and, if so, removes those from the goal base of the agent.
        Parameters:
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the procedure.
        agent - An optional agent to do the update for; the current agent is used otherwise

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The reward

      • contextQuery

        public java.util.Set<Substitution> contextQuery(MentalStateCond context,
                                       java.util.Map<Substitution,java.util.List<SingleGoal>> validatingGoals,
                                       Debugger debugger)
        Generates Substitutions that validate the given MentalStateCond, with the added restriction that only one goal in the goalbase may be used to validate it. This goal may be different for each of the returned substitutions.

        * Does focus/defocus using self.goal etc work in context condition too?? Nick: it should. for the filter focus method the context is just evaluated as a head of an action rule in the parent module. The select focus method should also have no problems, as it either queries the top-level set or the temporary set with just a single goal.
        This function seems very similar to MentalStateCond#evaluate(MentalState, SteppingDebugger). We might want to document which one to use when.

        known issues

        #1966 If there are no goals in the goalbase, contextQuery always returns an empty set. But this is wrong, for example querying not(goal(aap)) should return the empty substitution as solution, right? MentalStateCond#evaluate(MentalState, SteppingDebugger) seems to not have this problem.
        Parameters:
        context - The MentalStateCond to validate, usually a context from a Module.
        validatingGoals - An existing HashMap (usually empty), where links between Substitutions and SingleGoals are stored. Multiple goals may validate the same substitution.
        debugger - The SteppingDebugger in charge of the call.
        Returns:
        The set of Substitutions that validate the given MentalStateCond using only one goal from the goal base.
        Throws:
        KRQueryFailedException - If something went wrong when querying TODO: move to MentalStateCond.

      • getReceiversOfMessage

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getReceiversOfMessage(Message msg)
        Checks in the message base which agents this message has already been sent to, and returns their names as a Set of Strings.
        Parameters:
        msg - The Message to be search for in the message base
        Returns:
        a Set of agent names.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean addknowledge,
                        boolean addbeliefs,
                        boolean addpercepts,
                        boolean addmailbox,
                        boolean addgoals,
                        boolean focus)
        Converts belief base and/or goal base to text string.
        Parameters:
        addknowledge - set to true if knowledge should be included
        addbeliefs - set to true if beliefs should be included
        addpercepts - set to true if percepts should be included
        addmailbox - set to true if mailbox should be included
        addgoals - set to true if goals should be included
        focus - is true if we need to use current focus, or false if we need to reset to global focus.
        Returns:
        The text string

        Returns:

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        Returns the total number of queries and updates that have been performed on the BeliefBases and GoalBases of the Agent that owns this MentalState.
        Returns:
        The total number of queries and updates that have been performed.
